Description: Job OverviewHe/She will be responsible for performing a wide range of administrative duties, including managing paperwork, coordinating appointments, answering phones, and maintaining files.Responsibilities- Answer phones, respond to emails, and schedule appointments- Prepare and process real estate documents, such as contracts, leases, and agreements- Maintain accurate and organized files for properties and clients- Coordinate property showings and open houses- Process and manage payments, invoices and expenses- Assist in marketing efforts, such as creating flyers and posting on social media- Manage and update databases, client lists and real estate websites- Prepare reports and presentations for clients and management- Liaise with clients, agents, and vendors to ensure timely and efficient transactions- Provide general office support as needed, including ordering supplies and maintaining office equipmentSkills
Skills: The Administrator will have 2 years of previous experience in the real estate industry and a proven track record of providing exceptional administrative support.
He/She will have excellent communication skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
- Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Administrator in the real estate industry
- Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office and database management
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
- Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
- Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks
- Knowledge of real estate industry terminology and practices
- High school diploma or equivalent; Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred
